meanings.definition: A monetary unit in the Czech Republic and Slovakia.
meanings.sent1: In the Czech Republic, you can buy a snack for a few haler.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for haler when I visited Slovakia.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted haler coins, making it tricky to get a drink.
meanings.sent4: She saved every haler she earned, like a squirrel hoarding nuts.
meanings.sent5: The sound of haler coins clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that hauls.
meanings.sent1: The haler pulled the heavy cart with ease.
meanings.sent2: The truck driver was a skilled haler, transporting goods across the country.
meanings.sent3: The little robot acted as a haler, moving items around the warehouse.
meanings.sent4: She was a haler of information, always carrying news from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The ant was a tiny but mighty haler, carrying food many times its size back to the nest.

meanings.definition: A person who is healthy and strong.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the village haler, always ready to help with heavy tasks.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was a true haler, excelling in every competition.
meanings.sent3: The haler lumberjack chopped down trees effortlessly, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a haler warrior, ready to face any challenge that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The haler blacksmith forged metal with strength and precision, creating beautiful works of art.
